summary: Public health emergencies evolve quickly, but public health entities lack the ability to share new data and potentially life-saving information in real-time—undermining the nation's ability to respond quickly. To address this, the federal government must overcome three major challenges—specifically, the lack of: Common standards for collecting data (e.g., patient characteristics) "Interoperability" (meaning not all data systems work together) Public health IT infrastructure (the hardware, software...
title: Public Health Emergencies: Data Management Challenges Impact National Response
